Can I direct newbreak traffic to my Etsy store instead of shopify?

Yes, you can direct NewsBreak traffic to your Etsy store. You just need to set up your ad campaign with the correct URL pointing to your Etsy store. If you need help with setting up your ad campaign, feel free to ask!
If so, I can ignore the step asking for  event set up?

You can still set up event tracking even if you're directing traffic to your Etsy store. Event tracking helps you measure performance and optimize your campaigns. You can use a pixel or postback to track conversions like purchases or sign-ups. If you need more details on how to set this up, let me know!
Yes pls

Sure! To set up event tracking for your Etsy store, follow these steps:
1. Go to the 'Tools' tab in your NewsBreak Ad Manager.
2. Select 'Event Management'.
3. Choose whether you want to use a pixel or postback for tracking.
4. Follow the instructions to set up the pixel or postback on your Etsy store.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [Introduction to tCPA](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17827591199757-Introduction-to-tCPA). If you have any questions or need further assistance, feel free to reach out!
There are no instructions for Etsy

I understand. While there are no specific instructions for Etsy, you can still set up event tracking by following the general guidelines for integrating a postback or pixel. Here’s a general guide you can follow:
1. Log in to your NewsBreak Ad Manager account and go to 'Tools' > 'Event Management'.
2. Click on 'Create/Test web event'.
3. Name your event and choose the type of conversion event.
4. Follow the 3-step process to integrate your Pixel or Postback.
5. Test the Pixel or Postback using the ‘Go test’ feature.
6. Save and proceed with setting up your ad.
For more details, you can refer to this article: [Introduction to Multi-Event Tracking](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/23053537846669-Introduction-to-Multi-Event-Tracking).
If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out!
what is the 3-step process to integrate

The 3-step process to integrate your Pixel or Postback is as follows:
1. **Create the Event**: Log in to your NewsBreak Ad Manager account, go to 'Tools' > 'Event Management', and click on 'Create/Test web event'. Name your event and choose the type of conversion event you want to track.
2. **Set Up the Tracking**: Choose whether you want to use a Pixel or Postback for tracking. Follow the instructions provided in the Ad Manager to set up the Pixel or Postback on your website (in this case, your Etsy store). This usually involves copying a piece of code and placing it on specific pages of your site where you want to track conversions.
3. **Test and Save**: Use the ‘Go test’ feature at the bottom of the page to ensure that your tracking setup is working correctly. You should see a message indicating that the test was successful. Once confirmed, save your changes and proceed with setting up your ad campaign.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [Introduction to Multi-Event Tracking](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/23053537846669-Introduction-to-Multi-Event-Tracking).
If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out!
How do I place the code to my Etsy marketplace store?

Unfortunately, Etsy does not support placing custom tracking codes like pixels directly on their marketplace pages. However, you can still track conversions by using URL parameters and tracking tools that integrate with Etsy. You can set up your NewsBreak ad campaign to include specific URL parameters that help you identify traffic coming from NewsBreak.
For more detailed information on setting up custom pixels or postbacks, you can refer to this article: [Introduction to Multi-Event Tracking](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/23053537846669-Introduction-to-Multi-Event-Tracking).
If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out!
May I speak to a live agent pls

I'm here to help with whatever you need! Let me know your question, and I'll do my best to assist you right away. If you still need to speak with a live agent, I can help you get in touch with our support team.
live agent please
I've sent a request to our support team for you. They will get in touch with you shortly. If you have any other questions in the meantime, feel free to ask!
Do I need to set up the pixel or postback if I want to set up an ad campaign that directs to my Etsy marketplace store?

No, you do not need to set up a pixel or postback if you are directing traffic to your Etsy marketplace store. Since Etsy does not support custom tracking codes, you can simply set up your ad campaign with the URL pointing to your Etsy store. You can use URL parameters to track the traffic coming from NewsBreak. If you need more details on setting up your ad campaign, feel free to ask!
How come it says this: You haven’t selected an event. Ads won’t be delivered until you select an event to track.

It looks like you need to select an event to track in order to proceed with your ad campaign setup. Even though Etsy doesn't support custom tracking codes, you can still set up a basic event to satisfy this requirement. Here's what you can do:
1. Go to 'Tools' > 'Event Management' in your NewsBreak Ad Manager.
2. Click on 'Create/Test web event'.
3. Name your event and choose a simple conversion type, such as 'Page View'.
4. Save the event without adding any custom code.
5. Go back to your ad campaign setup and select the newly created event.
This should allow you to proceed with your ad campaign without needing to place any tracking code on your Etsy store.
If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out!
